para: As well as keeping track of which &nodes; are currently pinned, each &skel; maintains a stack of previous sets of pinned &nodes;. Whenever nodes are pinned or unpinned, a new set is pushed onto the stack. The Undo command pops the latest version off of the stack, thereby reverting to the previous set of pinned &nodes;. The popped version is not destroyed — it can be recovered with the command.
The stack is not infinite. When it is full, the oldest set of pinned &nodes; will be lost to make room for a new one.
